# TRACKLIST TEMPLATE
## Deep Space House Journey Analysis & Planning

---

## PURPOSE

This template provides a comprehensive framework for:
- **Planning** future journey sets
- **Analyzing** recorded mixes (yours or others')
- **Documenting** successful progressions
- **Learning** from what worked and what didn't

---

## FULL JOURNEY TEMPLATE

```
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
DEEP SPACE HOUSE JOURNEY TRACKLIST
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

MIX INFORMATION:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Mix Title: [Your journey name/title]
DJ/Artist: [Your name]
Date Recorded/Planned: [DD/MM/YYYY]
Total Duration: [XXX minutes]
Venue/Context: [Where played or intended venue]
Audience Type: [Intimate club / Festival / Radio / Practice]
Recording Link: [URL if recorded]

JOURNEY CONCEPT:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Theme: [Brief description - e.g., "Submarine depths to cosmic space"]
Emotional Arc: [e.g., "Introspective → Meditative → Uplifting → Resolved"]
BPM Range: [118-126 BPM]
Key Journey Moments: [Note 2-3 planned highlights or peaks]

TECHNICAL NOTES:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Equipment Used: [Traktor, CDJs, etc.]
Effects Focus: [Primary effects used - reverb, delay, filters]
Special Techniques: [Extended loops, live edits, etc.]
Preparation Level: [Fully planned / Partially planned / Improvised]

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
TRACK-BY-TRACK BREAKDOWN
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
TRACK 01: [Artist] - [Title] ([Remix/Version])
───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Label: [Label Name]
Duration in Mix: [MM:SS - MM:SS] (Total: [X] minutes [Y] seconds)
BPM: [XXX.XX]
Key: [X Major/Minor or tonal description]
Energy Level: [Low / Med-Low / Medium / Med-High / High]

ROLE IN JOURNEY:
Position: [Intro / Early Build / Mid / Peak / Wind-Down]
Function: [Establishes mood / Builds energy / Maintains groove / Peak moment / Conclusion]

TEXTURE & VIBE:
Primary Elements: [e.g., "Warm pads, submarine bass, minimal percussion"]
Frequency Profile: [e.g., "Sub-bass heavy, spacious mids, gentle highs"]
Emotional Tone: [e.g., "Introspective, warm, inviting"]
Standout Moment: [e.g., "Pad swell at 3:20, perfect for layering"]

MIX NOTES:
Mix-In Technique: [First track OR how blended from previous]
Loop Used?: [Yes/No - If yes: section and duration]
Effects Applied: [Reverb 30%, Filter sweep at 2:40, etc.]
Special Considerations: [Any notable technical or creative decisions]

NEXT TRANSITION:
Mix-Out Point: [MM:SS] (track timestamp when next track starts)
Transition Strategy: [Technique to be used - e.g., "High-pass filter blend, 75 seconds"]
Why This Track Next?: [Reasoning - e.g., "Builds on warm texture, slight BPM increase"]

PERFORMANCE NOTES:
What Worked: [Successful elements]
What Struggled: [Issues encountered]
Crowd Reaction: [If performed - dancer response]
Would Change: [Adjustments for next time]

───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
[Repeat above format for each track]
───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
POST-MIX ANALYSIS
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

JOURNEY ARC EFFECTIVENESS:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Opening (First 20 min): [How effective was the intro? Rating: X/10]
Development (Mid section): [Did the journey unfold naturally? Rating: X/10]
Peak/Plateau (If applicable): [Was the peak satisfying? Rating: X/10]
Resolution (Final 20 min): [Did the ending feel complete? Rating: X/10]

TECHNICAL EXECUTION:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Blend Quality: [How smooth were transitions? Rating: X/10]
Effects Usage: [Were effects enhancing or distracting? Rating: X/10]
Track Selection: [Did tracks work together? Rating: X/10]
Timing/Pacing: [Was the pace appropriate? Rating: X/10]

STANDOUT MOMENTS:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Best Transition: [Track X → Track Y - Why it worked]
Best Loop Extension: [Track X, section Y - Why it was effective]
Most Hypnotic Moment: [When and why]
Unexpected Success: [Something that worked better than planned]

AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Weakest Transition: [Track X → Track Y - What went wrong, how to fix]
Pacing Issues: [Too fast/slow in which sections]
Track Selection Misses: [Tracks that didn't fit, better alternatives]
Technical Mistakes: [Errors to avoid next time]

CROWD/AUDIENCE RESPONSE (if performed):
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Overall Energy: [Description of floor energy throughout]
Engagement Level: [High / Medium / Low throughout journey]
Peak Moment: [When was the crowd most engaged?]
Low Point: [When did energy dip? Why?]
Requests/Feedback: [Any direct feedback received]

LESSONS LEARNED:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1. [First major lesson]
2. [Second major lesson]
3. [Third major lesson]
4. [Additional insights]

TRACKS TO EXPLORE:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
- [Track/Artist discovered or that would have fit better]
- [Track/Artist to research for similar vibes]
- [Track/Artist someone requested or suggested]

NEXT JOURNEY IDEAS:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Concept: [Ideas for future journey themes]
Starting Point: [How to begin next journey]
New Techniques: [New techniques to try next time]

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
```

---

## QUICK REFERENCE TEMPLATE (SIMPLIFIED)

For faster documentation or planning:

```
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
QUICK TRACKLIST - [Mix Name] - [Date]
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
Total Time: [XX min] | BPM Range: [XXX-XXX] | Theme: [Brief description]

01. [00:00-XX:XX] Artist - Title (Label) [XXX BPM / Key]
    → [Brief note about role/transition]

02. [XX:XX-XX:XX] Artist - Title (Label) [XXX BPM / Key]
    → [Brief note]

03. [XX:XX-XX:XX] Artist - Title (Label) [XXX BPM / Key]
    → [Brief note]

[Continue for all tracks]

NOTES:
- Best moment: [Track X to Y transition]
- Issue: [Problem and solution]
- Next time: [What to adjust]
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
```

---

## ENERGY/VIBE GRAPH TEMPLATE

Visual representation of journey arc:

```
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
ENERGY GRAPH - [Mix Name]
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Energy Level (Low → High)

HIGH    |                        ╱──────╲
        |                    ╱───        ───╲
MED-HIGH|              ╱────                  ────╲
        |          ╱───                            ───
MEDIUM  |      ╱──                                    ──╲
        |   ╱──                                          ──╲
MED-LOW |╱──                                               ──╲
        |                                                     ───╲
LOW     |─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────╲
        └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
        0min  20min  40min  60min  80min  100min 120min 140min 160min

Track Markers:
▼ Track 1 (Intro)
▼ Track 3 (Building)
▼ Track 6 (Peak Plateau)
▼ Track 9 (Descent)
▼ Track 11 (Resolution)

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
```

## BPM PROGRESSION TEMPLATE

Track BPM changes throughout journey:

```
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
BPM PROGRESSION - [Mix Name]
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

BPM
126 |                        ●──────●
    |                    ●───        ───●
124 |              ●────                  ────●
    |          ●───                            ───●
122 |      ●──                                    ──●
    |   ●──                                          ──●
120 |●──                                               ──●
    |                                                     ───●
118 |─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────●
    └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
    Trk1  Trk2  Trk3  Trk4  Trk5  Trk6  Trk7  Trk8  Trk9  Trk10

Notes:
- Gradual climb from 118→124 BPM (Track 1-6)
- Plateau at 124-125 BPM (Track 6-8)
- Gentle descent 124→119 BPM (Track 8-10)

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
```

---

## KEY PROGRESSION TEMPLATE

Track harmonic relationships:

```
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
KEY PROGRESSION - [Mix Name]
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Track | Key        | Relationship to Previous | Blend Difficulty
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
01    | Dm         | N/A (First track)        | N/A
02    | Dm         | Same key                 | Easy ●○○○○
03    | F Major    | Relative major           | Easy ●○○○○
04    | Am         | Relative of F            | Easy ●○○○○
05    | C Major    | Relative of Am           | Easy ●○○○○
06    | G Major    | 5th relationship         | Medium ●●○○○
07    | Em         | Relative minor           | Easy ●○○○○
08    | Bm         | 5th relationship         | Medium ●●○○○
09    | D Major    | Relative major           | Easy ●○○○○
10    | Am         | Return to familiar key   | Medium ●●○○○

NOTES:
- Primarily stayed in related keys (easy blends)
- Track 6 required filter technique due to G Major shift
- Track 8 used breakdown section to navigate Bm entry
- Ended in familiar territory (Am/Dm family) for cohesion

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
```

---

## TEXTURAL PROGRESSION TEMPLATE

Track the evolution of textures:

```
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
TEXTURAL PROGRESSION - [Mix Name]
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Legend: ▓ = Dominant | ▒ = Present | ░ = Subtle | □ = Absent

Element        | Trk1 | Trk2 | Trk3 | Trk4 | Trk5 | Trk6 | Trk7 | Trk8
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Warm Pads      | ▓▓▓  | ▓▓▓  | ▒▒░  | ░░░  | □□□  | ░░░  | ▒▒░  | ▓▓▓
Cold Digital   | □□□  | ░░░  | ▒▒░  | ▓▓▓  | ▓▓▓  | ▒▒░  | ░░░  | □□□
Submarine Bass | ▓▓▓  | ▓▓▓  | ▓▓▓  | ▓▓▓  | ▒▒░  | ░░░  | ▒▒░  | ▓▓▓
Organic Perc   | ▒▒░  | ▓▓▓  | ▓▓▓  | ░░░  | □□□  | ░░░  | ▒▒░  | ▓▓▓
Synthetic Perc | □□□  | □□□  | ░░░  | ▒▒░  | ▓▓▓  | ▓▓▓  | ▓▓▓  | ▒▒░
Dub Delays     | ░░░  | ▒▒░  | ▓▓▓  | ▓▓▓  | ▒▒░  | ░░░  | ░░░  | ▒▒░
Cosmic Atmos   | □□□  | ░░░  | ░░░  | ▒▒░  | ▓▓▓  | ▓▓▓  | ▒▒░  | ░░░

PROGRESSION NOTES:
- Started warm and organic (Tracks 1-3)
- Transitioned to colder, synthetic territory (Tracks 4-6)
- Returned to warmth for resolution (Tracks 7-8)
- Submarine bass constant throughout (signature element)

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
```

## LABEL/ARTIST DISTRIBUTION

Track where your selections come from:

```
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
SOURCE DISTRIBUTION - [Mix Name]
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

LABELS:
Lucidflow Records: ████████ (8 tracks)
Echocord: ████ (4 tracks)
Styrax: ███ (3 tracks)
Plastic City: ██ (2 tracks)
Various: ███ (3 tracks)

ARTISTS:
Nadja Lind: █████ (5 tracks)
The Timewriter: ███ (3 tracks)
Fluxion: ██ (2 tracks)
Helly Larson: ██ (2 tracks)
Various: ████████ (8 tracks)

DIVERSITY NOTES:
- Heavy Lucidflow focus (cohesive aesthetic)
- Good dub techno representation (Echocord)
- Artist variety prevents repetition
- Next time: Explore more Helly Larson, less Nadja Lind

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
```

## LOOP USAGE LOG

Document loop extensions:

```
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
LOOP EXTENSIONS - [Mix Name]
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Track 03: Fluxion - Vibrant Visions
Loop Section: 4:00-5:00 (16-bar dub chord loop)
Extension: 2 minutes 30 seconds (5 loops total)
Reason: Crowd deep in trance, perfect texture for layering Track 04
Result: Highly successful, dancers locked in

Track 06: Nadja Lind - Memory Lane
Loop Section: 5:30-6:30 (16-bar percussion loop)
Extension: 1 minute 45 seconds (3.5 loops total)
Reason: Harmonic bridge between Track 05 and 07 (key change needed)
Result: Successful transition aid, loop stayed interesting

Track 09: The Timewriter - Nightvision
Loop Section: 3:15-4:00 (8-bar pad section)
Extension: 45 seconds (1.5 loops)
Reason: Extending peak moment, crowd energy high
Result: Slightly too short, could have extended 30 more seconds

LOOP STATISTICS:
Total Loops Used: 3
Total Extension Time: 5 minutes
Average Extension: 1:40 per loop
Longest Loop: Track 03 (2:30)
Success Rate: 3/3 (100%)

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
```

---

## PLANNING TEMPLATE (PRE-MIX)

Use before creating a journey:

```
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
JOURNEY PLAN - [Working Title] - [Date]
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

TARGET DURATION: [90 / 120 / 180 minutes]
VENUE/CONTEXT: [Where/why]
AUDIENCE: [Expected crowd type]

JOURNEY CONCEPT:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Theme: [One sentence theme]
Opening Mood: [How to start]
Peak Moment: [What's the climax, if any]
Closing Mood: [How to end]

BPM PLAN:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Start: [118-120 BPM]
Build to: [123-124 BPM]
Peak (if any): [125-126 BPM]
Wind down: [121-119 BPM]

TEXTURE PLAN:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Opening: [Warm pads / Cold atmospheres / Dub techno / etc.]
Middle: [Textural evolution plan]
Closing: [Return to X / New territory]

KEY TRACK CANDIDATES:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Must Include:
1. [Artist - Track] (Reason: Perfect intro / Peak moment / etc.)
2. [Artist - Track] (Reason: ...)
3. [Artist - Track] (Reason: ...)

Would Like to Include:
- [Artist - Track] (If fits)
- [Artist - Track] (If time permits)

POTENTIAL CHALLENGES:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
- [Issue: e.g., "Big BPM jump from Track X to Y"]
  Solution: [Plan to handle]
- [Issue: ...]
  Solution: [...]

BACKUP PLANS:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
If Too Deep: [List 2-3 lighter tracks to inject energy]
If Too Energetic: [List 2-3 deeper tracks to cool down]
If Technical Issue: [Emergency loop-worthy track]

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
```

---

## COMPARISON TEMPLATE

Compare multiple journeys or analyze growth:

```
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
JOURNEY COMPARISON
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

                    | Mix A          | Mix B          | Mix C
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Date                | [DD/MM/YY]     | [DD/MM/YY]     | [DD/MM/YY]
Duration            | [XX min]       | [XX min]       | [XX min]
Track Count         | [XX]           | [XX]           | [XX]
BPM Range           | [XXX-XXX]      | [XXX-XXX]      | [XXX-XXX]
Avg Blend Time      | [XX sec]       | [XX sec]       | [XX sec]
Loops Extended      | [X]            | [X]            | [X]
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Intro Quality       | [X/10]         | [X/10]         | [X/10]
Journey Flow        | [X/10]         | [X/10]         | [X/10]
Peak Effectiveness  | [X/10]         | [X/10]         | [X/10]
Resolution Quality  | [X/10]         | [X/10]         | [X/10]
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Overall Rating      | [X/10]         | [X/10]         | [X/10]

KEY DIFFERENCES:
Mix A: [What made this unique]
Mix B: [What made this unique]
Mix C: [What made this unique]

EVOLUTION NOTES:
[How has your mixing improved from A → B → C?]

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
```

---

## DIGITAL ORGANIZATION TIPS

### File Naming Convention
```
YYYYMMDD_VenueName_DeepSpaceHouse_DurationMin.md
Example: 20250123_BerghainPanorama_DeepSpaceHouse_120min.md
```

### Folder Structure
```
/DJ_Documentation
  /Journey_Plans (pre-mix planning documents)
  /Recorded_Journeys (post-mix analysis)
  /Practice_Sessions (practice mix notes)
  /Best_Progressions (save successful track sequences)
  /Troubleshooting_Log (document problems and solutions)
```

---

## CONCLUSION

Use these templates to:
- **Plan systematically** before performing
- **Document thoroughly** after performing
- **Learn continuously** from each journey
- **Build knowledge base** of what works
- **Track improvement** over time

The more detail you document, the more you learn. Over time, patterns emerge showing what works for you, your style, and your audiences.
